{{Wired embedded system |brand=Synology |model=DiskStation |revision=DS413 |asin=B008U69HOG |est_release_date=11/2012 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf= |availability=now |type=NAS |fcc_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=8.33 |pwr_conn=DIN |cpu1_brand=Freescale |cpu1_model=P1022 |cpu1_cspeed=1 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model= |ram1=1 GiB |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0, USB 2.0, eSATA |expansion_usb_num=3 |expansion_sata_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=USB 3.0 controller;Renesas;µPD720200 A1;D720200AF1, 1234KU714, JAPAN;1; ,,, 6-port SATA controller;Intel;82801JR;AF82801JIR, L2305A56, SLB8S, <...>.05, CHINA;1; |flags=fan, RTC w/ battery backup |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui_eth=00:11:32 }} {{TagLine|4-Bay Diskless Network Attached Storage (DS413)}} :[http://www.synology.su/products/76 Product page] (RU) {{•}} [https://www.synology.com/en-global/support/download/DS413 Support page]
*This is a 4-bay NAS. :It would appear to have two USB 3.0 ports and one USB 2.0 port.
*"BD141L2 08-06BD14114 V1.4" is silkscreened on the board :shown in the ''Akihabara News'' review linked below.
*CPU: [[Freescale#Network Processors|Freescale]] P1022 @1GHz Dual Core {{See also|List of NAS Devices}}
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/nas/nas-reviews/31939-synology-ds413-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] (11/2012) *[http://www.pcadvisor.co.uk/reviews/storage/3425455/synology-diskstation-ds413-review/ On '''PC Advisor''' (UK)] *[http://en.akihabaranews.com/120994/review/review-synology-ds413 On '''Akihabara News''' (in EN, @ JP)] (~11/2012) :also [http://web.archive.org/web/20130404085532/http://en.akihabaranews.com/120994/review/review-synology-ds413 via archive.org] (working picture gallery) :Removable SODIMM for RAM Memory :(''ADATA'' AD3S1333B1G9-BM1G <?>)
===Other=== *[http://ark.intel.com/products/34395/Intel-82801JR-IO-Controller '''Intel ARK''' page for the 82801JR I/O Controller]
===Possible used PSU(s)=== The power supply shown in the ''Akihabara News'' review :is a '''PGB''' EA11001E-120.
